definition[0]: money, land, or a written contract etc that is held by someone who is not directly involved in an agreement while the agreement is being achieved
definition[1]: when money or SECURITIES related to a business deal or disagreement between two people or organizations are kept by a THIRD PARTY while the deal is completed or the disagreement is settled
example[1]: The company stated that most of the proceeds from the sale will be held in escrow for future payments to creditors.
definition[2]: when documents, software etc are kept by a THIRD PARTY to make sure that someone performs their part of the agreement
